definition: to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure

sentences.english: The White House says it is determined not to ease the pressure.
sentences.chinese: 白宫表示，政府决定不放松对朝鲜的弹压。

definition: to compel sb to obey/to force into submission/to subjugate
to put down a revolt/to pacify a rebellion
to enlist enemy or rebel soldiers by offering amnesty/to bring to negotiated surrender
to reconcile/to mediate/to bring warring parties to agreement/to arbitrate
to start a rebellion/to rise in revolt
forced submission/to exploit advantage to force sb to do one's bidding
to betray one's party/to defect (from the communist party)/renegade faction
